about.title: A software engineer who found the value of product creation through entrepreneurship
paragraphs: I’m Taira, a software engineer based in the U.S. with a background in civil engineering and education entrepreneurship.
I majored in civil engineering at university and worked for several years at the Tokyo Metropolitan Government before founding a private tutoring school.
Through managing the school and teaching students, I came to strongly feel that technology has the power to turn ideas into reality, which led me to start learning programming.

Currently, I’m focusing on web development, and developing an education management app called "Juku Cloud" to address the issue of teacher-dependent instruction that I experienced during my three years of running the school.

career.title: Career Journey
career.description: My experience spans civil engineering in the public sector, founding a tutoring business, and building my own product.

civil-engineer.title: Joined Tokyo Metropolitan Waterworks Bureau
civil-engineer.description: After graduating from Tokyo Metropolitan University, I entered the Tokyo Metropolitan Government as a technical officer to work on urban disaster prevention projects, primarily handling seismic upgrades for large 50 cm water pipes.
civil-engineer.imageAlt: Illustration of a seismic-resistant water pipe

change-career-to-education.title: Launched a Private Tutoring School
change-career-to-education.description: While enjoying the stability of public service, I questioned a status-quo career path, resigned, and started a two-person tutoring school in Yokohama where I felt my strengths fit education entrepreneurship.
change-career-to-education.imageAlt: Illustration of a small tutoring classroom

expand-business.title: Opened a Second Campus
expand-business.description: Within eighteen months enrollment exceeded fifty students, so we opened a second campus to expand the business.

selected-as-entrepreneur-program.title: Selected for Entrepreneur Support Program
selected-as-entrepreneur-program.description: Chosen for METI’s “Shido Next Innovator 2023,” I learned startup fundamentals and was inspired by Silicon Valley’s speed and the ambition of fellow founders.
selected-as-entrepreneur-program.imageAlt: Scene from the Shido Next Innovator 2023 pitch event

launched-video-platform.title: Released a Past-Exam Video Platform
launched-video-platform.description: Built and launched a learning platform for viewing past-exam walkthrough videos using no-code tools, reinforcing my belief that technology can turn ideas into reality.
launched-video-platform.imageAlt: Screenshot of the online learning platform

quit-juku.title: Closed the Tutoring School
quit-juku.description: Relocated to the United States for my spouse’s job and closed the school, gaining invaluable lessons in both instruction and business operations.

move-to-us.title: Moved to the United States
move-to-us.description: With almost no prior experience abroad, I faced nerves about my first long-term move overseas but am now enjoying life in a new environment.
move-to-us.imageAlt: View of Los Angeles from an airplane window

start-learning-programming.title: Started Learning Programming
start-learning-programming.description: Once life settled down, I began studying programming—ready to join a bootcamp if I hit a wall, yet I managed to stay consistent with self-study.

launched-juku-cloud.title: Released Juku Cloud (MVP)
launched-juku-cloud.description: To solve the issue of instruction relying on individual teachers, I built and launched “Juku Cloud (MVP),” an education management app that shares student traits in the cloud.
